cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi ENE of Great Abaco Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west toward the northwestern Bahamas, then turning WNW/NW to make landfall along Florida’s east coast and arc north-northeast through Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: East-central Florida coast (roughly Boca Raton–Cape Canaveral corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm watches confined to portions of the Florida east coast and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings: NW Bahamas and Boca Raton FL to Flagler/Volusia County line FL; Tropical-storm warnings extend northward along the GA/SC coasts and around Florida’s Gulf side
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Bahamas, Florida Peninsula (east and west coasts), Georgia and South Carolina coasts, eventually inland SE U.S.
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: Not expected to come within 300 nmi during the 5-day forecast period
weather_observation.expected_leaving_port_date: Already safely away; no further influence expected
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not Listed (no Puerto Rico sites in Advisory #10 wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at San Juan, PR
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at San Juan, PR
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall from Nicole forecast for Puerto Rico
